From: robertdahl <rdahl@...>

Firedrill's compartments rearanged as soon as Redhot was out. He
transformed into his proud standing robot mode, his arms outstretched.
He then curled them in, and watched the seeker curl up. He turned
around, to Beachcomber transforming. "Well I guess we wait." Firedrill
said curiously, as he nelt down, using his arm to support the rest of
his body in a crouching position, as he gently investigated an old
burrow for some type of animal.

Beachcomber, now in robot mode as well, moved forward, a blue sheet of
metal slipping over his optics. It began to whirl to life, at the use of
energy, as he examined the hole. He examined the size, shape of
clawmarks, and type of feces, then began to match them up with a large
list of animal profiles he had in storage on his computer. "Hmmmmmm." he
said, truly interested in this mission. "I would guess a type of badger,
although I am not sure which one with the current information." he said
happily.

Firedrill looked up with curiousity, and in his gruff but soft voice
asked in bewilderment, "B, Badger?".

Beachcomber remembered that Firedrill had never been to earth, or any
other planet for that fact. 

(feel free to jump in any time Klant)
